Abstract: This paper provides a comprehensive guide to the methodological options available for conducting meta-analysis in organizational research. It discusses the importance of validity generalization and the correction for psychometric artifacts in estimating effect sizes. The paper reviews various techniques for research synthesis, highlighting the strengths and limitations of each approach. It also offers practical recommendations for researchers to enhance the rigor and transparency of their meta-analytic studies, ensuring robust and reliable findings that can inform theory and practice in the field.
